Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can include in their drawing various living things that might exist in a land habitat, such as trees, grasses, and animals like lizards or squirrels.
The student can include in their drawing various living things that might exist in a water habitat, such as fish, clams, and aquatic plants.
The student can show differences in the types of living things found in each habitat, comparing at least one living thing from each.
The student can represent patterns of plant and animal diversity by showing how certain plants and animals are specific to different habitats.
